original_text:
Book of Gold: Symbol Choice
Dalla Playson una nuova slot a tema egizio: Book of Gold: Symbol Choice vi porta in un misterioso tempio che nasconde ricchi tesori!
Tema e grafica
Il tema di questa slot machine prodotta dalla nota software house Playson non è certamente originale, anzi, si può dire che i giochi ambientati sulla riva del Nilo negli ultimi anni siano diventati l’equivalente delle Fruit Machine qualche decennio fa, popolari e giocate almeno una volta da tutti gli appassionati!
Sono state immesse in commercio centinaia di slot machine che vedono come protagonisti faraoni e divinità, e alcune di esse sono diventate dei veri e propri cult, come la fortunata serie di Book of Ra.
Book of Gold: Symbol Choice non è dunque niente di nuovo, e non lo è nemmeno per quanto riguarda il compartimento grafico, che seppur ben realizzato (come d’altronde tutti i giochi di casa Playson), non ci stupisce con animazioni in 3D o particolari effetti speciali.
La schermata iniziale e quella di gioco condividono lo stesso sfondo, un tempio di colore blu evanescente in cui si vedono appena le divinità che lo abitano, incluso per esempio il dio Anubi, mezzo uomo e mezzo cane.
La griglia di gioco è piuttosto essenziale, mentre nella parte inferiore dello schermo troviamo i tasti per il settaggio e quello che permette di accedere alla tabella dei pagamenti.
Caratteristiche principali della slot machine
Book of Gold: Symbol Choice oltre a essere una slot machine non particolarmente originale per quanto riguarda la tematica scelta, si rivela essere piuttosto scarna anche come modalità di gioco. Intendiamoci, un gameplay semplice e intuitivo non è una cosa negativa a priori, tuttavia ci saremmo aspettati che in questo caso fosse articolato abbastanza da fornire qualche motivo particolare per scegliere Book of Gold: Symbol Choice.
La griglia di gioco è tradizionale, con cinque rulli, tre righe e sole dieci linee di pagamento, sulle quali è possibile effettuare le proprie scommesse a partire da 0,20 fino a 100 monete.
Per vincere occorre formare delle combinazioni di due o tre simboli identici su una qualsiasi linea di pagamento.
Book of Gold: Symbol Choice non ci sorprende nemmeno con il ritorno teorico al giocatore (RTP): il suo 95,95% è nella media e con una volatilità alta significa che potrebbe essere tosto ottenere dei premi ma che con un po’ di pazienza potremmo vincere delle discrete somme.
Simboli e funzionalità di Book of Gold: Symbol Choice
I simboli presenti su Book of Gold: Symbol Choice sono le carte da gioco dal 10 all’Asso e quattro simboli regolari a tema Antico Egitto: l’Ankh, l’occhio, il faraone e Horus, con il faraone che rappresenta l’icona a valore maggiore.
Wild e Scatter invece non sono due simboli distinti ma un’unica icona che raffigura il libro dorato (Book of Gold) che dà il titolo alla slot: può avere funzione di jolly per completare delle combinazioni vincenti e, come Scatter, se compare almeno tre volte attiva la modalità Free Spins che regala giri gratuiti e moltiplicatori fino a 200x la scommessa.

raw_translation.response:
Book of Gold: Symbol Choice
From Playson comes a new Egyptian-themed slot machine: Book of Gold: Symbol Choice takes you to a mysterious temple hiding rich treasures!

Theme and graphics
The theme of this slot machine produced by well-known software house Playson is certainly not original. In fact, it can be said that games set on the banks of the Nile in recent years have become the equivalent of Fruit Machines a few decades ago, popular and played at least once by all enthusiasts! Hundreds of slot machines featuring pharaohs and deities have been released, and some of them have become real cults, such as the successful series of Book of Ra. 

Book of Gold: Symbol Choice is nothing new, and neither is the graphic compartment, which, although well executed (like all Playson games), does not amaze us with 3D animations or particular special effects. The initial screen and the game screen share the same background, a blue evanescent temple in which you can barely see the deities that inhabit it, including the god Anubis, half man and half dog. The game grid is quite essential, while at the bottom of the screen we find the buttons for setting and accessing the paytable.

Main features of the slot machine
Book of Gold: Symbol Choice, in addition to being a slot machine that is not particularly original in terms of the chosen theme, also turns out to be quite poor in terms of gameplay. Let's be clear, a simple and intuitive gameplay is not a negative thing a priori, but we would have expected that in this case, it would be articulated enough to provide some particular reason to choose Book of Gold: Symbol Choice. 

The game grid is traditional, with five reels, three rows, and only ten paylines, on which it is possible to place bets starting from 0.20 up to 100 coins. To win, it is necessary to form combinations of two or three identical symbols on any payline. Book of Gold: Symbol Choice does not even surprise us with the theoretical return to player (RTP): its 95.95% is average, and with high volatility, it means that it could be tough to get prizes but with a little patience, we could win decent sums.

Symbols and features of Book of Gold: Symbol Choice
The symbols present on Book of Gold: Symbol Choice are playing cards from 10 to Ace and four regular symbols with Ancient Egypt theme: the Ankh, the Eye, the Pharaoh, and Horus, with the Pharaoh representing the highest value icon. 

Wild and Scatter are not two distinct symbols but a single icon that depicts the golden book (Book of Gold) that gives the slot its title: it can function as a wild to complete winning combinations, and as a Scatter, if it appears at least three times, it activates the Free Spins mode that gives free spins and multipliers up to 200x the bet.

Review: Book of Gold: Symbol Choice
From Playson comes a new Egyptian-themed slot game: Book of Gold: Symbol Choice takes you to a mysterious temple that hides rich treasures!
Theme and Graphics
The theme of this slot machine, produced by the well-known software house Playson, is certainly not original. Indeed, one could say that games set on the banks of the Nile in recent years have become the equivalent of Fruit Machines of a few decades ago, popular and played at least once by all enthusiasts! 
Hundreds of slot machines have been released featuring pharaohs and deities, and some have become real cults, such as the successful Book of Ra series. 
Book of Gold: Symbol Choice is therefore nothing new, and this also applies to the graphic compartment, which, albeit well done (like all games from Playson), does not amaze us with 3D animations or special effects. 
The initial and game screens share the same background, a evanescent blue temple in which one can barely see its inhabiting deities, including Anubis, the half-man and half-dog god. 
The game grid is rather essential, while at the bottom of the screen we find the buttons for settings and the one that allows access to the pay table.
Main Features of the Slot Machine
Book of Gold: Symbol Choice, besides not being a particularly original slot machine regarding the chosen theme, also turns out to be quite sparse in its game modes. Let's be clear, a simple and intuitive gameplay is not a negative thing in advance. However, we would have expected it to be articulated enough in this case to provide some particular reasons to choose Book of Gold: Symbol Choice. 
The game grid is traditional, featuring five reels, three rows, and only ten pay lines, on which one can place bets from 0.20 to 100 coins. 
To win, you need to form combinations of two or three identical symbols on any pay line. 
Book of Gold: Symbol Choice also does not surprise us with its theoretical return to player (RTP): its 95.95% is average, and with high volatility, it means that it could be tough to get prizes, but with a little patience, we could win some decent amounts. 
Symbols and features of Book of Gold: Symbol Choice
The symbols present on Book of Gold: Symbol Choice are the playing cards from 10 to Ace and four regular symbols with Ancient Egypt themes: the Ankh, the Eye, the Pharaoh, and Horus, with the Pharaoh representing the highest value icon. 
The Wild and Scatter, on the other hand, are not two distinct symbols, but a single icon that depicts the golden book (Book of Gold) that gives its name to the slot: it can serve as a wildcard to complete winning combinations and, as a Scatter, if it appears at least three times, activates the Free Spins mode, which gives free spins and multipliers up to 200 times the bet.

Review: Book of Gold: Symbol Choice
From Playson comes a new Egyptian-themed slot game: Book of Gold: Symbol Choice takes you to a mysterious temple that hides rich treasures!
Theme and Graphics
The theme of this slot machine, produced by the well-known software house Playson, is certainly not original. Indeed, one could say that games set on the banks of the Nile in recent years have become the equivalent of Fruit Machines of a few decades ago, popular and played at least once by all enthusiasts! 
Hundreds of slot machines have been released featuring pharaohs and deities, and some have become real cults, such as the successful Book of Ra series. 
Book of Gold: Symbol Choice is therefore nothing new, and this also applies to the graphic compartment, which, albeit well done (like all games from Playson), does not amaze us with 3D animations or special effects. 
The initial and game screens share the same background, a evanescent blue temple in which one can barely see its inhabiting deities, including Anubis, the half-man and half-dog god. 
The game grid is rather essential, while at the bottom of the screen we find the buttons for settings and the one that allows access to the pay table.
Main Features of the Slot Machine
Book of Gold: Symbol Choice, besides not being a particularly original slot machine regarding the chosen theme, also turns out to be quite sparse in its game modes. Let's be clear, a simple and intuitive gameplay is not a negative thing in advance. However, we would have expected it to be articulated enough in this case to provide some particular reasons to choose Book of Gold: Symbol Choice. 
The game grid is traditional, featuring five reels, three rows, and only ten pay lines, on which one can place bets from 0.20 to 100 coins. 
To win, you need to form combinations of two or three identical symbols on any pay line. 
Book of Gold: Symbol Choice also does not surprise us with its theoretical return to player (RTP): its 95.95% is average, and with high volatility, it means that it could be tough to get prizes, but with a little patience, we could win some decent amounts. 
Symbols and features of Book of Gold: Symbol Choice
The symbols present on Book of Gold: Symbol Choice are the playing cards from 10 to Ace and four regular symbols with Ancient Egypt themes: the Ankh, the Eye, the Pharaoh, and Horus, with the Pharaoh representing the highest value icon. 
The Wild and Scatter, on the other hand, are not two distinct symbols, but a single icon that depicts the golden book (Book of Gold) that gives its name to the slot: it can serve as a wildcard to complete winning combinations and, as a Scatter, if it appears at least three times, activates the Free Spins mode, which gives free spins and multipliers up to 200 times the bet.
